maze
Class Maze

java.lang.Object
  maze.Board
      maze.Maze

public class Maze
extends Board

This class is an extension of Board class and provides functionality connected with using Board as a maze. New instance of maze automatically generates new maze by removing properly random generated walls.

Author:
£ukasz Barcikowski

Field Detail

SMALLEST_VALUE

static int SMALLEST_VALUE
Smallest value for width and length of the maze.

BIGGEST_VALUE

static int BIGGEST_VALUE
Biggest value for width and length of the maze. Changing it to bigger causes additional changes in key generation and resolving.

debugMode

private boolean debugMode
Indicates if maze is in debug mode. If yes generation and solving processes will be displayed in standard output. By default debug mode is false.

isGenerated

public boolean isGenerated
Indicates whether maze has been generated or is still a clean board.

mySolution

private java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> mySolution
Contains information on cells visited my sprite.

visitedCells

private java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> visitedCells
This field is used for generating the maze. It holds information on visited cells which have been "used" in generation process.

generationStack

private java.util.Stack<java.lang.Integer> generationStack
Stack used by generation algorithm.

myEntry

private int myEntry
Key identifying entry coordinates. Key is of form XXXXYYYY, where XXXX is x coordinate and YYYY is y coordinate. For generating and parsed bye getKey() and parseKey() methods.

myExit

private int myExit
Key identifying exit coordinates. Key is of form XXXXYYYY, where XXXX is x coordinate and YYYY is y coordinate. For generating and parsed bye getKey() and parseKey() methods.

spriteX

private int spriteX
X coordinate of sprite. Used for debug purposes.

spriteY

private int spriteY
Y coordinate of sprite. Used for debug purposes.

Constructor Detail

Maze

public Maze(int width,
            int height)
Generates new maze basing on new Board.

Parameters:
width - Width of maze board.
height - Height of maze board.
Method Detail

generateMaze

public void generateMaze()
                  throws CellsAreNotNeighborsException,
                         OutOfBoardException
This is one of the most important methods. It generates the maze by removing specific walls from the preset board using so called stack based algorithm.

Throws:
CellsAreNotNeighborsException - Thrown when generation tries to operate on non-neighboring cells.
OutOfBoardException - Thrown when generation exceeds board.

chooseExits

private void chooseExits()
This method sets entry and exit points on outer bounds of maze board. Each of selected cells is selected on different wall.

hasUnvisitedNeighbors

private boolean hasUnvisitedNeighbors(int x,
                                      int y)
This method allows to check if provided cell has some yet unvisited neighbors.

Parameters:
x - X coordinate for cell to be checked.
y - Y coordinate for cell to be checked.
Returns:
True if there are some unvisited neighbors, false otherwise.

isWallBetweenCells

private boolean isWallBetweenCells(int x1,
                                   int y1,
                                   int x2,
                                   int y2)
                            throws CellsAreNotNeighborsException,
                                   OutOfBoardException
This method checks if there is wall set between two provided cells.

Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of first cell.
y1 - Y coordinate of first cell.
x2 - X coordinate of second cell.
y2 - Y coordinate of second cell.
Returns:
True if there is wall between provided cells, false otherwise.
Throws:
CellsAreNotNeighborsException - Thrown if provided cells are not neighbors.
OutOfBoardException - Thrown if any of provided cells is outside the board.

setWallBetweenCells

private void setWallBetweenCells(int x1,
                                 int y1,
                                 int x2,
                                 int y2,
                                 boolean exists)
                          throws CellsAreNotNeighborsException,
                                 OutOfBoardException
Sets the wall between two provided cells.

Parameters:
x1 - X coordinate of first cell.
y1 - Y coordinate of first cell.
x2 - X coordinate of second cell.
y2 - Y coordinate of second cell.
exists - Desired state of the wall.
Throws:
CellsAreNotNeighborsException - Thrown if provided cells are not neighbors.
OutOfBoardException - Thrown if any of provided cells is outside the board.

getRandomNeighbor

private int getRandomNeighbor(int x,
                              int y)
Returns key representing the location of randomly selected neighbor of provided cell.

Parameters:
x - X coordinate of cell for which neighbor is to be selected.
y - Y coordinate of cell for which neighbor is to be selected.
Returns:
Location of neighbor as location key.

getKey

private int getKey(int x,
                   int y)
Provides a unique key for given coordinates. Accepted value range is (1,9999).

Parameters:
x - X coordinate.
y - Y coordinate.
Returns:
Unique key.

parseKey

private int[] parseKey(int key)
Parses a unique key for given coordinates.

Parameters:
key - Key to be parsed.
Returns:
Array of two integers [0] - x coordinate and [1] - y coordinate.

printMaze

public void printMaze()
Prints to standard output the maze with (if any) actual location of the sprite.

solveMaze

public java.util.Stack<java.awt.Point> solveMaze()
                                          throws MazeNotGeneratedException
Solves the maze using so called right hand rule. The way out is registered on a solution stack. Returns the solution of the maze as a stack of Points starting from exit (top of stack) to entry (bottom of the stack).

Returns:
Stack of point coordinates representing solution.
Throws:
MazeNotGeneratedException - Thrown when maze hasn't been generated yet.

getSolution

private java.util.Stack<java.awt.Point> getSolution()
Returns the solution of the maze as a stack of Points starting from exit (bottom of stack) to entry (top of the stack). After calling this function solution is lost.

Returns:
Solution back trace stack.

getEntry

public int[] getEntry()
Returns coordinates of entry point of the maze.

getExit

public int[] getExit()
Returns coordinates of exit point of the maze.

Returns:
Array of two integers [0] - x coordinate and [1] - y coordinate.

setDebugMode

public void setDebugMode(boolean isOn)
Sets the debug mode on or off. If debug mode is on (true) generation and solving processes will be traced by printing proper info to standard output.

Parameters:
isOn - Debug mode.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the maze to initial state.

optimizeSolution

private void optimizeSolution()
Optimizes solution by removing double visited cells. (i.e. all those sequences where sprite reached dead end and went back to some point)

lockEntry

private void lockEntry()
Locks entry point for generation process, so that sprite wouldn't go outside the board.

unlockEntry

private void unlockEntry()
Reopens the entry point.
